register.name: PHY_ID_0
register.comment: PHY ID 0, ASCII "PHY-"

register.name: PHY_ID_1
register.comment: PHY ID 1, ASCII BANDWIDTH,TX_SS,RX_SS,TC

register.name: PHY_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: PHY configuration (one for each of the two paths in RSDB builds)

register.name: PHY_CONFIG[1]
register.comment: PHY configuration (one for each of the two paths in RSDB builds)

register.name: PHY_RESET
register.comment: Async reset for phy blocks

register.name: PHY_RAM_POWER
register.comment: RAM power controls for various sections of the PHY. For each three bit field, bit 1 is PDE and bit 0 is RETN, normally 0b011 for power off, 0b101 for power on

register.name: PHY_RAM_POWER2
register.comment: RAM power controls for ON state and transitions from ON to OFF. Shared between all power sequencers these set the RAM power sequence: POWER_XX_OFF ->gt; POWER_TURN_ON ->gt; POWER_ON ->gt; POWER_TURN_OFF ->gt; POWER_XX_OFF

register.name: PHY_SEMAPHORE[0]
register.comment: General-use mutual exclusion lock for a single resource

register.name: PHY_SEMAPHORE[1]
register.comment: General-use mutual exclusion lock for a single resource

register.name: PHY_SEMAPHORE[2]
register.comment: General-use mutual exclusion lock for a single resource

register.name: PHY_SEMAPHORE_3
register.comment: General-use mutual exclusion lock for up to 3 resources

register.name: CAPTURE_BASE_ADDR
register.comment: Capture base address must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: CAPTURE_BUFFER_LEN
register.comment: Capture buffer length must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: CAPTURE_CONTROL
register.comment: This register controls the data capture features within the capture block

register.name: CAPTURE_INTERVAL_CONTROL
register.comment: Capture interval settings

register.name: EVENT_COUNT_CONTROL[0]
register.comment: This register configure capture trigger events to be counted

register.name: EVENT_COUNT_CONTROL[1]
register.comment: This register configure capture trigger events to be counted

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[0]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[1]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[2]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[3]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[4]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[5]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[6]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: EVENT_COUNT[7]
register.comment: Store the event count for EVENT_SEL0...7

register.name: CAPTURE_STATUS
register.comment: Capture and DMA channel state

register.name: CAPTURE_CUR_ADDR
register.comment: Capture current address

register.name: PLAYBACK_BASE_ADDR
register.comment: Playback base address must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: PLAYBACK_BUFFER_LEN
register.comment: Playback buffer length must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: PLAYBACK_CONTROL
register.comment: This register controls the data Playback features within the Playback block

register.name: PLAYBACK_STATUS
register.comment: Playback and DMA channel state

register.name: PLAYBACK_CUR_ADDR
register.comment: Playback current address

register.name: EVENT_CONTROL_0
register.comment: enables for event capture

register.name: EVENT_CONTROL_1
register.comment: enables for event capture

register.name: EVENT_GENERATE
register.comment: generates event from software

register.name: EVENT_HIGH
register.comment: high 32 bits of software generated events

register.name: EVENT_MATCH[0]
register.comment: Event ID matches that generate interrupt or capture trigger

register.name: EVENT_MATCH[1]
register.comment: Event ID matches that generate interrupt or capture trigger

register.name: EVENT_DMA_BASE_ADDR
register.comment: Events logging base address must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: EVENT_DMA_BUFFER_LEN
register.comment: Events logging buffer length must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: EVENT_STATUS
register.comment: EVENT logging status

register.name: EVENT_DMA_CUR_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformee0 DMA read current address

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_SELECT[0]
register.comment: Controls bits 31:16 and 15:0 of the debug multiplexers' output. The multiplexers are organized hierarchically, one nibble controlling multiplexer at each hierarchical level. Selecting 0 for any of the multiplexer positions disables the debug output, setting PHY_DEBUG_SELECT_0 for both bus segments to zero disables the clock to any debug logic.

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_SELECT[1]
register.comment: Controls bits 31:16 and 15:0 of the debug multiplexers' output. The multiplexers are organized hierarchically, one nibble controlling multiplexer at each hierarchical level. Selecting 0 for any of the multiplexer positions disables the debug output, setting PHY_DEBUG_SELECT_0 for both bus segments to zero disables the clock to any debug logic.

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_READ
register.comment: Reads the instantaneous value of the output of the debug multiplexers.

register.name: PHY_FEATURES_ENABLE
register.comment: Enable bits for the features implemented in PHY

register.name: BBA_BF_RX0_DMA_EN
register.comment: Beamformee 0 DMA channel enable

register.name: BBA_BF_RX0_DMA_BASE_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformee 0 base address is treated as 16-byte aligned by the DMA engine. The four LSBs are used only to set the initial bit position for the first data to be packed. The DMA will write only complete 16-byte words.

register.name: BBA_BF_RX0_DMA_BUFFER_LEN
register.comment: Beamformee 0 buffer length must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: BBA_BF_RX0_STATUS
register.comment: BBA_BF_RX0 status

register.name: BBA_BF_RX0_DMA_CUR_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformee0 DMA read current address

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_CONTROL
register.comment: This register controls the beamformer angle fetch DMA

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_BASE_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformer angle fetch DMA base address, can be any byte address. The base address is treated as 16-byte aligned by the DMA engine. The four LSBs are used by the beamformer set the initial bit position for the first data to be unpacked.

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_BUFFER_LEN
register.comment: Beamformer angle fetch buffer length (bytes)

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_CUR_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformer DMA read current address

register.name: DMA_INTERRUPT_DISABLE
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear

register.name: DMA_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear

register.name: DMA_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear

register.name: DFE_RX_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Rx configuration bits

register.name: DFE_RX_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Rx antenna status and latency measurements

register.name: DFE_RX_LNA_PHASE_COMP_CONFIG1[0]
register.comment: Configuration for LNA phase compensation - WL LNA.

register.name: DFE_RX_LNA_PHASE_COMP_CONFIG2[0]
register.comment: Configuration for LNA phase compensation - WL LNA.

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCH_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register configures the two notch filters in each of the receive chains. The lower 5 bits configure the OFDM filter and the next 5 bits the CCK filter. The MSB enables the notch filter in front of the rx_ctrl module

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCHA_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Rx status of notch filter A (OFDM) in each of the receive chain.

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCHB_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Rx status of notch filter B (CCK) in each of the receive chain.

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCH_PRELOAD[0]
register.comment: This is the value loaded into the memory element of the notch filters if requested

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register configures the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_FREQ[0]
register.comment: This sets the frequencies of the tones used by the signal analyser. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65_536 and dividing by 160_000_000. This sets the frequency of the tone used by the signal analyser.

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_CONFIG1[0]
register.comment: This register controls phase and magnitude compensation for the receive signals in the first receive chain, and has a bit which enables frequency compensation for both receive chains.

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_CONFIG2[0]
register.comment: Configuration parameters for the averaging block in the Rx IQ Compensation measurement block

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_DC[0]
register.comment: This register controls the ADC DC level compensation parameters

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_DELAY_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register controls the receiver delay compensation parameters

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_PHASE_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Configuration for receiver phase compensation

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_AMPL_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Configuration for receiver amplitude compensation

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_AUTO_COEFFS[0]
register.comment: The current values of automatic I/Q trims can be read back from this register. The trim values are in sign/magnitude format. The phase trim is in the upper 8 bits and the amplitude trim in the lower 8 bits of this register. By setting the DFE_RX_COMP_LUT_READ_EN bit in the DFE_RX_COMP_CONFIG1 register, entries in the compensation table can also be read.

register.name: DFE_RX_PHASE_COMP_LUT_STATUS[0]
register.comment: This register reads the current phase compensation LUT entry

register.name: DFE_RX_AMPL_COMP_LUT_STATUS[0]
register.comment: This register reads the current amplitude compensation LUT entry

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_MATRIX_I_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register controls the receiver IQ matrix compensation parameters for output I samples.

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_MATRIX_Q_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register controls the receiver IQ matrix compensation parameters for output Q samples.

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH0_I_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed I value generated by channel 0 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH0_Q_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed Q value generated by channel 1 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH1_I_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed I value generated by channel 1 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH1_Q_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed Q value generated by channel 1 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Signal analyser status bits.

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Register to control operation of the internal signal generator. SigGen must be enabled in DFE_SIGGEN_ENABLE to start

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG2[0]
register.comment: Register to control operation of the internal signal generator - logical extension of DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_FREQ1[0]
register.comment: This sets the frequency of the primary (only) tone used by the signal generator. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65 536 and dividing by the sample rate of the injection point (The sample rate is currently 160Msps for TX and 320Msps for RX).

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_FREQ2[0]
register.comment: This sets the frequency of the secondary tone used by the signal generator. The value for a given frequency can be found by The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65 536 and dividing by the sample rate of the injection point (The sample rate is currently 160Msps for TX and 320Msps for RX).

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_PHASE[0]
register.comment: This register has two functions: it is the value preloaded into the accumulator used to generate the first tone, so can set the phase of that tone relative to the second tone or the signal analyser tone. Also, it is used to provide the DC level in that mode of operation

block.name: phy_fleximac
block.comment: PHY FlexiMAC control and status registers

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1
register.comment: Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_RF[0]
register.comment: DFE and RF Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission. This register has a size of 2. For non-mimo modes register 0 is used. For Mimo modes the two registers are used to allow configuration of the different TX chains

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_RF[1]
register.comment: DFE and RF Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission. This register has a size of 2. For non-mimo modes register 0 is used. For Mimo modes the two registers are used to allow configuration of the different TX chains

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_IQ_COMP1
register.comment: DFE IQ Compensation Parameters 1

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_IQ_COMP2
register.comment: DFE IQ Compensation Parameters 2

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_START_DELAY
register.comment: Delay from TxEnable rising edge detected to data being passed to the DACs

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_PAPR
register.comment: PAPR Threshold

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR2_PARAM1
register.comment: Allows the CPU to write the Tx parameters required before the end of LTF1 transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR2_PARAM2
register.comment: Allows the CPU to write the Tx parameters required before the end of LTF1 transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR2_LENGTH
register.comment: Allows the CPU to write the Tx parameters required before the end of LTF1 transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR3
register.comment: HT-GF: Allows the CPU to write the required Tx parameters before the end of HT-LTF1 transmission. all other packet types : Allows the CPU to write the required Tx parameters before the end of LTF2 transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_LSIG
register.comment: L-SIG bytes : by the end of LTF1 transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_SIG1
register.comment: HT-GF Bytes : before the end of HT-LTF1 symbol transmission. HT-MM/VHT/HE SIG1 Bytes: before the end of L-LTF2 symbol transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_SIG2
register.comment: HT-GF Bytes : before the end of HT-LTF1 symbol transmission. HT-MM/VHT/HE SIG1 Bytes: before the end of L-LTF2 symbol transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_SIGB
register.comment: VHT SIGB Bytes : before the end of L-LTF2 symbol transmission..

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_STATUS
register.comment: Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SPARE_TIMING_MODEL_FORCE_CRC_ERROR
register.comment: In Silicon this register is SPARE and available for ECOs. In the Timing Model this is used to force CRC errors in the transmitted signal fields

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VECTOR1
register.comment: Rx parameters from received packet, zero when no packet has been received

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VECTOR2
register.comment: Rx parameters from received packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_TB_VECTOR1
register.comment: Configuration1 for Rx trigger based packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_TB_VECTOR2
register.comment: Configuration2 for Rx trigger based packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_FREQ_OFF
register.comment: Rx frequency offset measurements from received packet per selected antenna (in ppm??? Hz??)

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIG_QUAL
register.comment: Rx signal quality measurements from received packet, per selected antenna

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_RCPI
register.comment: Rx received channel power indicator from received packet per selected antenna, equal to (rx_power_in_dBm+110)*2

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_WRSSI[1]

register.comment: Contents of the HT-SIG(A1) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VHT_SIG_B
register.comment: Contents of the HT-SIG(B) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_A1
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIG(A1) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_A2
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIG(A2) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_B_COMMON_PART1
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIGB Common Block content_channel[31:0]

register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIGB User field targeted for us (where the STA-ID matches the register TODO)

register.comment: Received Scrambling Seed

register.comment: 1 indicates PHY format is unsupported, 0 otherwise

register.comment: OFDM digital energy measured in channel 0 for each Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz subband is always mapped to Channel 0.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT_CH0[1]
register.comment: OFDM digital energy measured in channel 0 for each Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz subband is always mapped to Channel 0.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT_CH1[0]
register.comment: OFDM digital energy measured in channel 1 for each Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Secondary20 MHz subband is always mapped to Channel 1.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT_CH1[1]

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT_CH2[0]

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_PACKET_CCA[0]
register.comment: CCA for each 20MHz subband for each Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz channel is always mapped to Channel 0; Secondary20 MHz is always mapped to Channel 1; Channel 2 and Channel 3 always correspond to the Secondary 40. Channel 0 is the lowest 20MHz subband

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_PACKET_CCA[1]
register.comment: CCA for each 20MHz subband for each Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz channel is always mapped to Channel 0; Secondary20 MHz is always mapped to Channel 1; Channel 2 and Channel 3 always correspond to the Secondary 40. Channel 0 is the lowest 20MHz subband

register.name: BB_HE_MULTI_BSS_BRC_STA_ID_I2
register.comment: Multi-BSS Broadcasting STA ID

register.name: BB_HE_MU_STA_ID_I2
register.comment: HE MU MY STA ID

register.name: BB_HE_UNASSIGNED_RU_STA_ID_I2
register.comment: Unassigned RU STA ID

register.name: BB_HE_MY_STA_ID_PRIORITY_I2
register.comment: HE My Sta Id Priority

register.name: BB_HE_SINGLE_BSS_BRC_PRIORITY_I2
register.comment: HE Single BSS Broadcasting Priority

register.name: BB_HE_MULTI_BSS_BRC_PRIORITY_I2
register.comment: HE Multi-BSS Broadcasting Priority

register.name: BB_HE_UNASSOCIATED_BRC_PRIORITY_I2
register.comment: HE unassociated Broadcasting Priority

register.name: BB_SYNC_LSIG_CHECK_EN_I2
register.comment: L-SIG Validation Check En

register.name: BB_SYNC_LSIG_CHECK_THR_I2
register.comment: L-SIG Validation Check Threshold

register.name: BB_RX_CRC_ABORT_CONFIG_I2
register.comment: Receiver configuration for sig crc aborting

register.name: BB_RX_FORCE_CLOCK_I2
register.comment: Force clock enable of manual clock gating if there is any logic bug

register.name: BB_BBA_REC_BF_TX_COEF_CONFIG_I2
register.comment: Reciprocal Beamforming, calibration coefficient LUT Config Register

register.name: BB_BBA_REC_BF_TX_COEF_I2[0]
register.comment: Reciprocal Beamforming, calibration coefficient LUT Config Register

register.name: BB_BBA_REC_BF_TX_COEF_I2[1]
register.comment: Reciprocal Beamforming, calibration coefficient LUT Config Register

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_CONFIG_I2
register.comment: TX beamforming configuration. For most fields, only teh Tx Path 0 register is used

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_KEYHOLE_I2
register.comment: TX beamforming configuration #2.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_STATUS1_I2
register.comment: Tx beamformer CBR category fields parsed.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_STATUS2_I2
register.comment: Tx beamformer fields parsed and DMA collision counter.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_ANGLE_STORE_KEYHOLE_DATA_STATUS_I2
register.comment: This register is used to read the angle store data.

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_CONFIG2_I2
register.comment: Config for Tx filtering stages

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_EVM_PARAMS_I2
register.comment: Used to tune the gain in the upsample filters in preproc to enhance the Evm across the preproc

register.name: BB_TX_CTRL_STATES_I2
register.comment: Tx control states

register.name: BBB_TX_PKT_CONFIG
register.comment: Configuration to disable standards-required features. Do not change this register.

register.name: BBB_TX_FILTER_CONFIG
register.comment: Transmit 40-to-44 MHz filter

register.name: BBB_TX_PKT_STATUS
register.comment: CCK transmitter state machine current state

register.name: BBB_RX_FILTER_CONFIG
register.comment: 40 to 44MHz resampling filter settings. These settings are applied to the two instances of this filter module, for I and Q signals.

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_PKT_CONFIG
register.comment: Configures detection of SFD (Start Frame Delimiter), aka Packet Sync

register.name: BBB_RX_ENERGY_DETECT_AGC_OFFSET
register.comment: Signed offset added to the AGC input to the Energy Detect to compensate for different AGC gain ranges in S61X, S620

register.name: BBB_RX_DESENSE_THRESHOLD
register.comment: RX desensitization threshold

register.name: BBB_CCA_CONFIG
register.comment: configuration registers used for CCK jump and low energy detection

register.name: BBB_RX_JUMP_DET_RSSI_LIMIT
register.comment: The Jump Detection should be valid only when the RSSI value is within a particular range

register.name: BBB_CCA_LOW_ENERGY_DETECTION_CONFIG
register.comment: Configuration register to monitor the selected band and see if the energy falls below a threshold

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_SYM_CONFIG3
register.comment: Configuration of CCK symbol synchronizer with pattern matching criteria (See B-65913)

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_SYM_CONFIG4
register.comment: More configuration related to CCK symbol synchronizer with pattern matching criteria (See B-65913 and B-77346)

register.name: BBB_RX_DIVERSITY_CFG
register.comment: Configuration for DSSS/CCK switched diversity reception

register.name: BBB_RX_JUMP_DET_CONFIG
register.comment: B Modem signal legacy jump detector configuration

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_SYM_PAT_L
register.comment: Pattern to match for Long preamble

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_SYM_PAT_S
register.comment: Pattern to match for Short preamble

register.name: BBB_RX_FREQ_ERROR
register.comment: RxFreqErrorKHz = ((Reg Value in 2s complement) * 44000) / (11 * 65536 * 4)

register.name: BBB_RX_PKT_STATUS
register.comment: CCK receiver state machine current state

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_SYM_BLANK_TIME
register.comment: Interval at start of CCK symbol detection time to blank if needed to avoid transient effects after rx antenna switch in CCK switched diversity chop mode. Each unit of time is 1 microsec

block.name: wl_enc_dma_0
block.comment: Wireless LAN DMA encryption accelerator registers

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Clear interrupt status events.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_MASK_I0
register.comment: Disable interrupt sources if a mask bit is set to '1'.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_CAUSE_I0
register.comment: Interrupt events status.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_DMA_DONE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Number of DMA_DONE events required to generate a DMA_DONE interrupt event. 0 = 1 event required to generate interrupt. 255 = 256 events required to generate interrupt.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_DMA_DONE_COUNT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Current status of the number of DMA_DONE events since the last reset or interrupt clear.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_DST_COUNT_SENT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Write '1' to clear the DST_COUNT interrupt event sent flag and allow subsequent DST_COUNT interrupts for the current DMA operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Interrupt generation configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENCR_TYPE_I0
register.comment: Encryption operation, one of:

register.name: ENC_DMA_KEY_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Encryption key length 128 or 256

register.name: ENC_DMA_FRAME_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Frame body length in octets

register.name: ENC_DMA_HDR_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Frame header length in octets

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENC_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Contains the following configuration bits:

register.name: ENC_DMA_PRIORITY_OCTET_I0
register.comment: Priority octet used in TKIP MIC calculation. Set to zero in this case. For CCMP operation, bits set to 1 in this octet will be set to one in the Nonce Flags Octet. It should be set to 0x10 for Management frames but should be set to 0xFF for Cisco CCX S67 compatibility; it must be set to 0x0 otherwise. (Refer to 802.11w section 8.3.3.3.3)

register.name: ENC_DMA_FC_MASK_I0
register.comment: Frame Control Mask. Determines which Frame Control bits are masked (i.e. included in the AAD calculation) in CCMP mode. Its default value is 0xC78F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2)

register.name: ENC_DMA_AAD_QC_MASK_I0
register.comment: Additional Authentication Data QoS Control field mask value for CCMP encryption. Set to 0x0F unless both the STA and its peer have their SPP A-MSDU Capable fields set to 1. In that case, set to 0x8F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2 g)

register.name: ENC_DMA_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Configuration settings for the DMA logic.

register.name: ENC_DMA_KEY_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Location in 32-bit address space of the encryption key to be used in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BUFFER_START_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Start address of the source buffer in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BUFFER_START_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Start address of the destination buffer in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BUFFER_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Length of the source buffer in bytes in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BUFFER_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Length of the destination buffer in bytes in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Offset for the next operation. This is a result of (current operation start + length) % buffer end address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Offset for the next operation. This is a result of (current operation start + length) % buffer end address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SET_SRC_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Set the offset for the next operation. This overrides the last hardware-calculated value.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SET_DST_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Set the offset for the next operation. This overrides the last hardware-calculated value.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AUTO_DST_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: In auto length mode this shows the calculated length of the destination data written out.

register.name: ENC_DMA_FRAME_CONTROL_FIELD_I0
register.comment: In auto header length mode this is used to work out the length of the header.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AUTO_HEADER_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: In auto header length mode this shows the calculated header length.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_START_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Start address of descriptor table. Write to update the external registers.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Number of entries in the descriptor table. Each entry is 4 bytes long. This allows the table to be continuous and wrap around.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_ADD_I0
register.comment: Write a value to this register to indicate than more entries have been addedto the descriptor table.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_CURRENT_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Current address of the descriptor table.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_ENTRY_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Count of entries currently in the descriptor table.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SKIP_OFFSET_I0
register.comment: The number of bytes to skip at the start of each descriptor table or single buffer mode operation. This is added to the current offset before beginning the operation. It applies to all operations, including straight DMA operations.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[0]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[0]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[0]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[0]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[1]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[1]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[1]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[1]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[2]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[2]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[2]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[2]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[3]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[3]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[3]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[3]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[4]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[4]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[4]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[4]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[5]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[5]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[5]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[5]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[6]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[6]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[6]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[6]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I0[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I0[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I0[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SG_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Scatter-gather per-operation setting. The number of bytes to read from the source before halting and generating an interrupt (ENC_DMA_INT_SRC_PAUSE). This is the initial value captured when loading the SG registers on an ENC DMA start operation. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SG_DST_COUNT_INT_EN_I0
register.comment: Scatter-gather per-operation setting. Set this to 1 to cause an interrupt when the bytes written to memory passes the threshold set in ENC_DMA_DST_COUNT_BYTE_COUNT. This is set once per DMA operation, not per scatter-gather list entry.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: This is the override for the currently-active set in the SG operation queue. Writing to this *overwrites* the currently-active value inside the ENC DMA block. The value can be increased as required or set to 0. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_ACTIVE_STATUS_I0
register.comment: The currently-active byte count at which the AXI source reading will be paused.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_COUNT_BYTE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: The number of bytes to write to the destination before generating an interrupt (ENC_DMA_INT_DST_COUNT). The value can be increased as required. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BYTE_COUNT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes read from the AXI bus for the currently-active operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BYTE_COUNT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes written to the AXI bus for the currently-active operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_FIFO_READ_TIMEOUT_I0
register.comment: If the destination scatter-gather list is configured such that the wide output FIFO gets stuck with less data than a whole word width in it before the last AXI burst occurs then wait this many cycles before forcing the final read from the FIFO.

register.name: ENC_DMA_STROBE_I0
register.comment: Write to individual bits in thie register to perform various operations. Only one bit whould be set at a time.

register.name: ENC_DMA_QUEUE_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Indicates the number of operations completed. Software must read this number before programming any configuration registers, and may write configuration registers only when this number is less than 2 (in SG mode).

register.name: ENC_DMA_OPERATION_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Indicates the outcome of the corresponding encryption operation. One of: ENC_DONE, ENC_STATUS_MIC_FAIL (MIC failed), ENC_DMA_DONE (DMA operation has been finished), AXI_READ_SLAVE_ERROR, AXI_READ_DECODE_ERROR, AXI_WRITE_SLAVE_ERROR, AXI_WRITE_DECODE_ERROR

register.name: ENC_DMA_STATE_I0
register.comment: DMA current state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_STATE_FIFOS_I0
register.comment: DMA current state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_AXI_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Current AXI bus state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_CORE_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Encryption accelerator state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_MAX_AXI_READ_BURST_NUM_I0
register.comment: Max mumber of outstanding read AXI bursts, for debug only. Upto 8 are theoretically supported in the logic but only if there is space for all of them in the SRC FIFO.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AXI_CACHE_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: AXI cache control settings, for debug only

register.name: ENC_DMA_AXI_BURST_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: AXI bus access configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AHB_REG_CLK_REQ_EXTEND_CYCLES_I0
register.comment: Number of cycles to extend the AHB clock request for after the register access has completed.

register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I1[6]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I1[6]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I1[6]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_START_ADDR_I1[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BLOCK_CONFIG_I1[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Source block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_START_ADDR_I1[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block address low

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BLOCK_CONFIG_I1[7]
register.comment: Scatter-gather list, Destination block configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SG_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_I1
register.comment: Scatter-gather per-operation setting. The number of bytes to read from the source before halting and generating an interrupt (ENC_DMA_INT_SRC_PAUSE). This is the initial value captured when loading the SG registers on an ENC DMA start operation. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SG_DST_COUNT_INT_EN_I1
register.comment: Scatter-gather per-operation setting. Set this to 1 to cause an interrupt when the bytes written to memory passes the threshold set in ENC_DMA_DST_COUNT_BYTE_COUNT. This is set once per DMA operation, not per scatter-gather list entry.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_I1
register.comment: This is the override for the currently-active set in the SG operation queue. Writing to this *overwrites* the currently-active value inside the ENC DMA block. The value can be increased as required or set to 0. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_ACTIVE_STATUS_I1
register.comment: The currently-active byte count at which the AXI source reading will be paused.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_COUNT_BYTE_COUNT_I1
register.comment: The number of bytes to write to the destination before generating an interrupt (ENC_DMA_INT_DST_COUNT). The value can be increased as required. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BYTE_COUNT_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes read from the AXI bus for the currently-active operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BYTE_COUNT_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes written to the AXI bus for the currently-active operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_FIFO_READ_TIMEOUT_I1
register.comment: If the destination scatter-gather list is configured such that the wide output FIFO gets stuck with less data than a whole word width in it before the last AXI burst occurs then wait this many cycles before forcing the final read from the FIFO.

register.name: ENC_DMA_STROBE_I1
register.comment: Write to individual bits in thie register to perform various operations. Only one bit whould be set at a time.

register.name: ENC_DMA_QUEUE_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Indicates the number of operations completed. Software must read this number before programming any configuration registers, and may write configuration registers only when this number is less than 2 (in SG mode).

register.name: ENC_DMA_OPERATION_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Indicates the outcome of the corresponding encryption operation. One of: ENC_DONE, ENC_STATUS_MIC_FAIL (MIC failed), ENC_DMA_DONE (DMA operation has been finished), AXI_READ_SLAVE_ERROR, AXI_READ_DECODE_ERROR, AXI_WRITE_SLAVE_ERROR, AXI_WRITE_DECODE_ERROR

register.name: ENC_DMA_STATE_I1
register.comment: DMA current state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_STATE_FIFOS_I1
register.comment: DMA current state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_AXI_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Current AXI bus state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_CORE_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Encryption accelerator state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_MAX_AXI_READ_BURST_NUM_I1
register.comment: Max mumber of outstanding read AXI bursts, for debug only. Upto 8 are theoretically supported in the logic but only if there is space for all of them in the SRC FIFO.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AXI_CACHE_CONFIG_I1
register.comment: AXI cache control settings, for debug only

register.name: ENC_DMA_AXI_BURST_CONFIG_I1
register.comment: AXI bus access configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AHB_REG_CLK_REQ_EXTEND_CYCLES_I1
register.comment: Number of cycles to extend the AHB clock request for after the register access has completed.

block.name: wl_mac_acc
block.comment: Wireless LAN FlexiMAC MAC Accelerator registers

register.name: MAC_ACC_CONTROL
register.comment: General control register

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_RX_CONFIG
register.comment: TX and RX options

register.name: MAC_ACC_SCHEDULED_EVENT
register.comment: Scheduled events

register.name: MAC_ACC_SCHEDULED_EVENT1_TIME
register.comment: Time of MAC_ACC_SCHEUDLED_EVENT1

register.name: MAC_ACC_SCHEDULED_EVENT2_TIME
register.comment: Time of MAC_ACC_SCHEUDLED_EVENT2

register.comment: Time of MAC_ACC_SCHEUDLED_EVENT3

register.name: MAC_ACC_SCHEDULED_EVENT4_TIME
register.comment: Time of MAC_ACC_SCHEUDLED_EVENT4

register.name: MAC_ACC_SCHEDULED_EVENT5_TIME
register.comment: Time of MAC_ACC_SCHEUDLED_EVENT5

register.comment: Time of MAC_ACC_SCHEUDLED_EVENT6

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_RX_CONTROL
register.comment: TX/RX immediate control

register.name: MAC_ACC_PSDU_LENGTH
register.comment: PSDU length used to pad Zero-Length delimiters for an A-MPDU

register.name: MAC_ACC_TIMER
register.comment: Current value of MAC ACC's 32-bit Timer

register.name: MAC_ACC_STATUS
register.comment: General status register

register.name: MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt status. See MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENUMS for bit fields

register.name: MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt enable. See MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENUMS for bit fields

register.name: MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt clear. See MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENUMS for bit fields

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_DWARF_MPDU_COUNT
register.comment: Count of MPDUs that were ignored because the length indicated was less than 4 bytes. This includes standalone MPDUs and MPDUs sent as part of an AMPDU.

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_ZERO_LEN_MPDU_COUNT
register.comment: Count of standalone MPDUs that were ignored because the length indicated was null.

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_STARVATION_COUNT
register.comment: Count of PSDU bytes going to the PHY upto the first starvation byte

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_ON_REQUEST_ERROR_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the cause(s) that triggered MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_RX_ON_REQUEST_ERROR

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_OFF_REQUEST_ERROR_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the cause(s) that triggered MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_RX_OFF_REQUEST_ERROR

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_START_REQUEST_ERROR_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the cause(s) that triggered MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_TX_START_REQUEST_ERROR

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_STOP_REQUEST_ERROR_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the cause(s) that triggered MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_TX_STOP_REQUEST_ERROR

register.name: MAC_ACC_DEBUG_SELECT
register.comment: Debug select

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: TX Debug Status

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: RX Debug Status

block.name: wl_mac_if
block.comment: Wireless LAN FlexiMAC MAC Interface registers

register.name: MAC_IF_CONTROL
register.comment: General control register (state is persistant)

register.name: MAC_IF_CONTROL_AMNESIC
register.comment: General control register (state is transitory). Writing a 0 to a bit has no effect. Returns zero if read (not last value written)

register.name: MAC_IF_STATUS
register.comment: General status register

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START
register.comment: Address of start of Receive Buffer. Offset from start of RAMS. Units of 1k bytes. Address = MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START*1024

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Receive Buffer. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 255 => 256k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_GIVE
register.comment: Receive Buffer Write Pointer. Updated 'live' as each quadword is written to RAMS

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_GIVE_EMEND
register.comment: Allows firmware to modify Receive Buffer Write Pointer. Must only be written when Receive Buffer Write Pointer is not in active use. Entire register must be written atomically. If read, this register will return the last value written (not zero)

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_TAKE
register.comment: Receive Buffer Read Pointer. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_TRIGGER
register.comment: Controls the generation of the Receive Give Interrupt. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER_START
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer. Offset from start of RAMS. Units of 1k bytes. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER_START*1024

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 0. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 255 => 256k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_STRUCTURE
register.comment: Transmit Structure Table Read Pointer. Address of next entry in Transmit Structure Table that hardware will read. Offset from start of RAMS. Updated 'live' as each entry is read. Two lsb always 0. (Debug aid)

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_STRUCTURE_EMEND
register.comment: Allows firmware to modify Transmit Structure Table Read Pointer. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0. If read, this register will return last value written (not zero)

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BASE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer Base Pointer. Defines the start of valid data in the Transmit Buffer. May be (temporarily) set 'above' MAC_IF_TX_GIVE to indicate an area of the Transmit Buffer (give -> base) which does not and will not contain valid data. If firmware falls behind schedule creating the Transmit Buffer's data, it can abandon the creation of some data, with the aim of meeting the schedule for later data

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_GIVE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer Write Pointer. Defines the end of valid data in the Transmit Buffer. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_TAKE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer Read Pointer. Updated 'live' as each quadword is read from Transmit Buffer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_TAKE_EMEND
register.comment: Allows firmware to modify Transmit Buffer Read Pointer. Must only be written when Transmit Buffer Read Pointer is not in active use. Entire register must be written atomically. If read, this register will return the last value written (not zero)

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_TRIGGER
register.comment: Controls the generation of the Transmit Take Interrupt. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt Raw Status register. This is a 'sticky' register. The (transient) interrupt sources can (only) set the bits to 1. Bits may be cleared to 0 by writing to MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR. When the MAC IF is Disabled, the interrupt sources are prevented from updating INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt Status register. Value in this register is MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS ANDed with MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE. If one or more of the bits in this register are 1, then the interrupt output signal from the MAC IF will be asserted

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt Enable register. Allows the various interrupt sources to be enabled / masked. If masked (i.e. a bit is a 0), then the interrupt source will not cause an interrupt, but the source may still be polled via MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt Clear register. Writing a 1 to a bit will (typically) clear (set to 0) the corresponding bit in MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS. Writing a 0 has no effect. Returns zero if read (not last value written)

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_SELECT
register.comment: Debug Select

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: Debug Status

register.name: MACPP_VERSION
register.comment: Dummy version string. LSbit is used in simulations for chip id (0 or 1).

register.name: MACPP_PERW_REGISTER_HASH
register.comment: Contains a 16-bit hash of all the PERW register tree source used in the IP.

register.name: MACPP_PIO_DRIVE
register.comment: PIO drive.

register.name: MACPP_PIO_DRIVE_EN
register.comment: PIO drive enables.

register.name: MACPP_PIO_STATUS
register.comment: PIO status.

register.name: MACPP_LOCAL
register.comment: Scratch register.

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_MAC2WLBT_SET
register.comment: Write 1 in the corresponding bit to raise an IRQ line to main WLBT PP. Writing 0 has no effect.

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_MAC2WLBT_CLR
register.comment: Write 1 in the corresponding bit to clear an IRQ line to main WLBT PP. Writing 0 has no effect.

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_MAC2WLBT
register.comment: Status of the IRQ lines to main WLBT PP

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_WLBT2MAC_SET
register.comment: Write 1 in the corresponding bit to raise an IRQ line from main WLBT PP. Writing 0 has no effect.

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_WLBT2MAC_CLR
register.comment: Write 1 in the corresponding bit to clear an IRQ line rom main WLBT PP. Writing 0 has no effect.

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_WLBT2MAC
register.comment: Status of the IRQ lines from main WLBT PP

register.name: MACPP_IRQ2MAC_SET
register.comment: Write 1 in the corresponding bit to raise an IRQ line to other MAC PP in an RSDB system. Writing 0 has no effect

register.name: MACPP_IRQ2MAC_CLR
register.comment: Write 1 in the corresponding bit to clear an IRQ line from other MAC PP in an RSDB system. Writing 0 has no effect

register.name: MACPP_IRQ2MAC
register.comment: Status of the IRQ lines to other MAC PP

register.name: MACPP_TIMER_TIME
register.comment: Read-only Timer Time from WLBT PP

register.name: MACPP_REGS_FAILED_ADDRESS
register.comment: Address of last register access that failed to complete successfully, usually resulting in a CPU abort of some sort.

register.name: MACPP_REGS_STATUS
register.comment: Observe the APB bus failure status. Write to a field to clear it.

register.name: MACPP_COEX_ALLOWED
register.comment: Coex control for the various BT and WLAN activities

register.name: MACPP_CAM_COMP_DATA1
register.comment: Upper 17 bits of CAM comparator data

register.name: MACPP_CAM_MATCH
register.comment: Index into array of first data match, 0xFFFF_FFFF for no match. There is an extra cycle of latency before this register is valid. i.e. After writing a CAM_COMP_DATA or CAM_ARRAY register, one clock cycle of delay must be inserted before this register is read.

register.name: BIT_SHIFTER_SHIFT_VAL[0]
register.comment: Amount to shift data as a 2's compliment number. Range is -254 to 254. Shifts of >=255 are not valid. Positive values shift left. Zero extension is used. Shift occurs once on writing this register. Shifts less than or equal to 127 bits take one cycle. Larger shifts take an extra cycle. Accesses to the BitShifter on this extra cycle will be waited one cycle.

register.name: BIT_SHIFTER_MODE[0]

register.name: BIT_SHIFTER_CLEAR[0]

register.name: BIT_SHIFTER_SHIFT_VAL[3]
register.comment: Amount to shift data as a 2's compliment number. Range is -254 to 254. Shifts of >=255 are not valid. Positive values shift left. Zero extension is used. Shift occurs once on writing this register. Shifts less than or equal to 127 bits take one cycle. Larger shifts take an extra cycle. Accesses to the BitShifter on this extra cycle will be waited one cycle.

register.name: BIT_SHIFTER_MODE[3]
register.comment: Action on writing to Bit Shifter Data array.

register.name: BIT_SHIFTER_CLEAR[3]
register.comment: Write anything to this register to clear the Bit Shifter Data array.

register.name: MACPP_CLK_REQ_EXTEND_CYCLES
register.comment: The number of clock cycles to extend the request for the various clock gates after the activity is complete.

register.name: WL_RADIO_CLOCK_CONTROL

register.name: WL_RADIO_SPARES

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG4_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG5_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_DIG_RSSI_TIME_I0
register.comment: This register specifies programmable configurations to measure digital RSSI for different purposes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_DIG_RSSI_TIME2_I0

register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for an OFDM receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for a CCK receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_HE_SU_ER_RSSI_TARGET_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for an OFDM HE-SUER receive burst after decimation. Note this target value only takes affect for Nudge Again operation for Nudge WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET is used.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a OFDM receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a CCK receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_HE_SU_ER_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a OFDM receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CS_CONFIG_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_GAIN_LUT2_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_BB_GAIN_LUT0_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_EXT_LNA_GAIN_LUT_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_RX_SLOT_DELAYS_I1[0]
register.comment: These registers set the delays for the receive timer slots in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.comment: These registers set the delays for the receive timer slots in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.comment: These registers set the delays for the receive timer slots in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.comment: These registers set the delays for the receive timer slots in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.comment: These registers set the delays for the receive timer slots in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_RX_SLOT_ON_OFF_LAST_I1
register.comment: This register sets the start and end of Rx turn on and off ramps, and the slot jumped to in the case of an Rx abort

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_TX_SLOT_I1
register.comment: This register contains the current slot selected by the Tx timer

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_RX_SLOT_I1
register.comment: This register contains the current slot selected by the Rx timer

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_STATUS_I1
register.comment: This register contains the current values of the Radio Enables, after all masking and multiplexing

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_I1
register.comment: Default values for radio enables signals should the mask register select this rather than the timer outputs

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_MASK_I1
register.comment: Selects use of RADIO_ENABLES or timer outputs. A one in a given bit selects the timer output.

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_TX_TRAIN_MASK_I1
register.comment: Selects use of RADIO_ENABLES or timer outputs. A one in a given bit selects the timer output. Used only when predistort training is active to allow Rx blocks to be turned on

register.name: WL_RADIO_DEBUG_STATUS_I1
register.comment: This read-only register returns the current state of the debug bus within radio control.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG1_I1
register.comment: Miscellaneous config bits for the AGC as follows:

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG2_I1
register.comment: Configuration bits for the AGC: initial gain settings before first update comes from RF chip

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG3_I1
register.comment: Configuration bits for the AGC: digital gain range definition. Also initial baseband gain until first update arrives from RF chip

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG4_I1
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: digital gain settings

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG5_I1
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: clipping detection behaviour

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG6_I1
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG7_I1
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG9_I1
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG10_I1
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG11_I1
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_TIMEOUT_I1
register.comment: This register specifies programmable timeouts for the AGC

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_DIG_RSSI_TIME_I1
register.comment: This register specifies programmable configurations to measure digital RSSI for different purposes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_DIG_RSSI_TIME2_I1
register.comment: This register specifies programmable configurations to measure digital RSSI for different purposes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_DIG_RSSI_TIME3_I1
register.comment: This register specifies programmable configurations to measure digital RSSI for different purposes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET_I1
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for an OFDM receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_I1
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for a CCK receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_HE_SU_ER_RSSI_TARGET_I1
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for an OFDM HE-SUER receive burst after decimation. Note this target value only takes affect for Nudge Again operation for Nudge WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET is used.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I1
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a OFDM receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I1
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a CCK receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_HE_SU_ER_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I1
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a OFDM receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CS_CONFIG_I1
register.comment: This register configures the carrier sense. It is asserted when analogue gain is less than a threshold and digital RSSI is greater than a threshold. The thresholds are set in this register

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_INDEX_LUT0_I1
register.comment: LUT for conversion of FE gain to LNA and Mixer gain and vice versa.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_INDEX_LUT1_I1
register.comment: LUT for conversion of FE gain to LNA and Mixer gain and vice versa.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_GAIN_LUT0_I1
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each FE gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_GAIN_LUT1_I1
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each FE gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_GAIN_LUT2_I1
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each FE gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_BB_GAIN_LUT0_I1
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each analogue baseband gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_BB_GAIN_LUT1_I1
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each analogue baseband gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_BB_GAIN_LUT2_I1
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each analogue baseband gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_EXT_LNA_GAIN_LUT_I1
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each external LNA gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_CONFIG_I1
register.comment: Coadj general config register

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_CONFIG2_I1
register.comment: Coadj general config register 2

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Coadj general status register

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_COMMS_I1
register.comment: General Communication register. Bracken gets an interrupt event when this is writtem

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_TIMER_I1
register.comment: Timer initial value, downcount at core clk rate starts on write

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_ADDR_I1
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Address. MSBs=2'b00: DataStore, 2'b10: Core internal regs, 2'b11: Local regs

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_WDATA_I1
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Write Data - auto increments address on write

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_RDATA_I1
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Read Data - auto increments address on read

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_RF_FLAGS_I1
register.comment: Zippy flag data (info and channel) to be sent to RFIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_BB_FILTER_I1
register.comment: Filter bitmap for Zippy channels that cause an interrupt to be raised on traffic to the BBIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_RF_CFG_I1
register.comment: Zippy channel configuration for SW data to the BBIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_BB_FLAGS_I1
register.comment: Zippy flag data to the BBIC, plus latched Valid and Ack
